Technique: FORMED BY HAND; PAINTED; ENGRAVED; FAYENCE; ENGRAVED
Name: Shabti
Description: This fragment of a funerary statue in blue faience was part of the collection of Ã‰. de Meester de Ravestein. The name of the owner, noted on the front part, is unfortunately not preserved. The name of his mother, on the contrary, is written on the dorsal pillar. The icongraphical characteristics suggest that the shabti dates from the Late Period.
